metadata.title: Theoretical Framework for the Development of a Black Flying Saucer Based on Symbiotic Transduction of Black Light via an Axial Node
metadata.description:
This theoretical framework presents the physical and mathematical foundations
for the design of a Black Flying Saucer, a hypothetical propulsion and energy re-
distribution device based on the Black Motor hypothesis. We explore the redistri-
bution of energy via an axial node that behaves as a symmetry-bifurcation point and governs the reversibility of spacetime curvature and energy flow. In this model,
so-called “dark energy” is interpreted not as a cosmological constant but rather as
a form of symbiotic transduction of black light. This framework combines fractal
electromagnetism, axial topology, and field symbiosis under the principles of the
Kemet Gravity Theory.
references: https://youtu.be/DNXcUPeiB0Q?si=3-qCwqrAWcvTZUTp

data.title: Theoretical Framework for the Development of a Black Flying Saucer Based on Symbiotic Transduction of Black Light via an Axial Node

metadata.title: Black Platforms: Symbiotic Fractal Devices for Levitation, Habitat and Vertical Transport
metadata.description:
This work introduces a scalable and modular class of devices known as Black
Platforms, built upon the fractal-palindromic electromagnetic hypothesis and sym-
biotic transduction technology. These platforms enable autonomous levitation and
energy circulation for various terrestrial applications such as floating birdhouses,
vertical elevators, garden bases, or meditative pods. Their design is an extension
of the Black Motor and Black Cruiser principles adapted to micro-scale harmonic
interactions.

data.title: Black Platforms: Symbiotic Fractal Devices for Levitation, Habitat and Vertical Transport

metadata.title: Black Cruiser: A Fractal-Palindromic Vessel for Autonomous Energy Navigation
metadata.description:
This article introduces the concept of the Black Cruiser, an advanced theoretical
spacecraft built upon the principles of the Black Motor and the electromagnetic hypothesis of black as a palindromic fractal. The energy core is based on a self-
sufficient system of symbiotic transduction that reorganizes ambient and vacuum
radiation into usable thrust and control energy. The cruiser functions as a modular
and scalable extension of the original concept, adapted for long-range navigation,
fractal curvature manipulation, and multidimensional folding.

data.title: Black Cruiser: A Fractal-Palindromic Vessel for Autonomous Energy Navigation

metadata.title: The GEBNUT Model: Symbiotic Transduction of Black Light into Electricity via Fractal-Palindromic Electromagnetic Structures and Kemet Gravity Corrections
metadata.description:
The GEBNUT model presents a novel framework for transducing black light
into electricity by leveraging the hypothesis of suspended photons, Einstein’s
photoelectric effect, and the corrected unit system of Kemet Gravity The-
ory (KGT). Black light is modeled not as an absence of photons, but as
a gravitationally-veiled state of inward-drifting photons. The model em-
ploys a fractal-palindromic reinterpretation of the electromagnetic spectrum
to achieve reversible energy transformations. This results in a theoretical
device capable of self-sustained, symbiotic interaction with ambient fields,
converting dark electromagnetic energy directly into usable electric power.
references: https://youtu.be/krPSeJZylMA?si=2EU-M2JowSXtCcuE

data.title: The GEBNUT Model: Symbiotic Transduction of Black Light into Electricity via Fractal-Palindromic Electromagnetic Structures and Kemet Gravity Corrections

metadata.title: Unified Theorem of Symbiotic Transduction for Atomic and Antiatomic Synthesis: GEBNUT, Kemta, and Bemhot Integration
metadata.description:
This article proposes a unified theoretical and experimental frame-
work combining the GEBNUT model, the Kemta Atomic Model, and
the Kemta Antiatomic Model. By integrating the fractal-palindromic
transduction of black electromagnetic fields (GEBNUT) with the struc-
tural algebraic necessity of atomic and antiatomic triplets (Kemta/Bemhot),
we propose the synthesis of superatomic structures that do not anni-
hilate but stabilize through symbiotic field interaction. The result
is a theorem of superatomic transduction, followed by a protocol for
empirical simulation and possible laboratory implementation.

data.title: Unified Theorem of Symbiotic Transduction for Atomic and Antiatomic Synthesis: GEBNUT, Kemta, and Bemhot Integration

metadata.title: Assessing Antiviral Mechanisms of N-acetyl-D-glucosamine, N-acetylcysteine and Acetylsalicylic acid on SARS-CoV-2
metadata.description:
Objective: The potential antiviral activity of FDA-approved 3 compounds (N-acetyl-D-glucosamine; GlcNAc, N-acetylcysteine; NAC, and Acetylsalicylic acid; ASA) against SARS-CoV-2 was investigated.

Materials and Methods: Molecular docking analysis of these compounds as ligands with the main 22 viral proteins was made to predict their possible interaction.

Results: All molecules showed interactions with the viral proteins; the mean binding scores for GlcNAc and ASA were very close (-6.81 kcal/mol and -6.31 kcal/mol, respectively), while NAC designated the lowest value (-4.69 kcal/mol). GlcNAc showed the highest binding energy of -8.80 kcal/mol against both the target proteins RdRp-RTP site (7BV2) and Helicase-ANP binding site (7NN0).

Conclusion: Since these 22 proteins, including main protease (Mpro) and Papain-like protease (PLpro), are responsible for replication and various pathogenesis processes, it could be concluded that these FDA-approved commercially available compounds have antiviral properties against SARS-CoV-2, which should be confirmed with further in vivo and clinical trials.
references: Avdeev, S. N., Gaynitdinova, V. V., Merzhoeva, Z. M., & Berikkhanov, Z. G. (2022). N-acetylcysteine for the treatment of COVID-19 among hospitalized patients. The Journal of infection, 84(1), 94–118. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jinf.2021.07.003

metadata.title: The Origin of the Universe, the Perception of Time, and Samsara: A Genotypic and Phenotypic Framework for Consciousness and Abiogenesis
metadata.description:
This article presents a unified empirical and metaphysical hypothesis of cosmic
origin, temporal perception, and biological evolution, rooted in the interpretation
of the genotype as ”soul”, the phenotype as ”spirit”, and consciousness as
bioelectric transduction. The paper proposes that abiogenesis is not a sponta-
neous accident but a fractal transduction of the universe’s intrinsic geometrical
structures into life. Living beings are thereby reflections of astronomical archi-
tectures, and the samsaric cycle becomes observable through empirical mappings
of life and form. A corollary postulate is introduced: black holes do not exist
as voids, but rather as ”blackstars” — dense celestial objects emitting dark-
spectrum gamma light, visible through correct calibration. This reframes black as
a palindromic fractal within the electromagnetic continuum.

data.title: The Origin of the Universe, the Perception of Time, and Samsara: A Genotypic and Phenotypic Framework for Consciousness and Abiogenesis

metadata.title: Eyes of Ra: A Symbiotic Energy Visor for Ocular Protection Against Photosensitivity and Epileptic Attacks Based on Palindromic Fractal Electromagnetic Theory
metadata.description:
This paper presents the theoretical and mathematical framework
for the design and construction of an energy visor known as Eyes of
Ra. Inspired by the hypothesis of black as a palindromic fractal, the
visor is designed to protect the eyes from photosensitivity, epileptic
attacks, and other adverse effects related to electromagnetic fields.
Through a symmetric energy transduction mechanism and a fractal
axial node, the Eyes of Ra neutralizes and modulates harmful light fre-
quencies, allowing ocular protection without interfering with normal
vision. This study is based on axial geometry and fractal electromag-
netic field theory to provide an innovative and sustainable approach
to energy protection.

data.title: Eyes of Ra: A Symbiotic Energy Visor for Ocular Protection Against Photosensitivity and Epileptic Attacks Based on Palindromic Fractal Electromagnetic Theory

metadata.title: Black Armor N2: Theoretical Framework for a Symbiotic Electromagnetic Exosuit Based on Palindromic Fractal Field Dynamics
metadata.description:
This document presents the theoretical, mathematical, and philosophical foun-
dation of the Black Armor N2, a symbiotic electromagnetic exosuit that requires
no external energy input. The system is based on palindromic fractal field geom-
etry and electromagnetic self-symbiosis. By harmonizing environmental radiation
through a transduction matrix and axial symmetry, the Black Armor N2 generates
a continuous, reactive protective field around the body. The project explores the
mathematical basis of palindromic field theory, the physical construction of a self-
contained armor, and the metaphysical implications of black as a central symmetry
of energy.

data.title: Black Armor N2: Theoretical Framework for a Symbiotic Electromagnetic Exosuit Based on Palindromic Fractal Field Dynamics
